description: Azure monitor dashboard for Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server health including server health, resource usage (cpu, memory, iops, storage), connections, throughput, latency etc.

options.content:
# Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server - Monitoring Dashboard
#### - Each metric is emitted at a 1-minute interval and has up to 93 days of history.
#### - For a complete list of metrics, refer to [Azure PostgreSQL Monitoring Metrics](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/postgresql/flexible-server/concepts-monitoring)

panels.description: Indicates if the database is up or not
panels.title: Database State

panels.description: Percentage of CPU in use
panels.title: CPU Usage (Avg)

panels.description: Percentage of memory in use
panels.title: Memory Usage (Avg)

panels.description: Percent of storage space that's used. The storage that's used by the service can include database files, transaction logs, and server logs
panels.title: Storage Usage Percent (Avg)

panels.description: Used and Free storage. The storage that's used by the service can include the database files, transaction logs, and the server logs.
panels.title: Storage Used/Free

panels.description: The storage you provision is the amount of storage capacity available to your Azure Database for PostgreSQL server. The storage is used for the database files, temporary files, transaction logs, and the PostgreSQL server logs
panels.title: Total Provisioned Storage

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used by the transaction logs
panels.title: T-Log Storage Used (Bytes)

panels.description: Read Replica Configured
panels.title: Read-Replica

panels.description: Number of connections to your server
panels.title: Active Connections

panels.description: Number of succeeded connections
panels.title: Succeeded Connections

panels.description: Number of total transactions executed in this database.
panels.title: Total Transactions

panels.description: Number of data disk I/O read operations per second.
panels.title: Read IOPS

panels.description: Number of data disk I/O write operations per second
panels.title: Write IOPS

panels.description: Bytes read per second from disk
panels.title: Read Throughput

panels.description: Bytes written to disk per second
panels.title: Write Throughput

panels.description: Amount of incoming network traffic
panels.title: Network In (Bytes)

panels.description: Amount of outgoing network traffic
panels.title: Network Out (Bytes)

options.content: #### **NOTE**: While metrics are stored for 93 days, you can only query (in the Metrics tile) for a maximum of 30 days worth of data on any single chart. If you see a blank chart or your chart displays only part of metric data, verify that the difference between start and end dates in the time picker doesn't exceed the 30-day interval. After you've selected a 30-day interval, you can pan the chart to view the full retention window.

panels.description: Percentage of CPU in use
panels.title: CPU / Memory

panels.description: Number of transactions executed within a second.
panels.title: Transactions per second (Preview)

panels.description: Number of total transactions executed in this database (by database)
panels.title: Total Transactions by database (Top n)

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used by the transaction logs
panels.title: Transaction Log Storage Used (Bytes)

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's used. The storage that's used by the service can include the database files, transaction logs, and the server logs
panels.title: Storage Used (Bytes)

panels.description: Amount of storage space that's available
panels.title: Storage Free (Bytes)

panels.description: Number of active, failed and succeeded connections to your server.
panels.title: Server Connections

panels.description: Max Connections represents the configured value for the _max_connections_ server parameter. This metric is pooled every 30 minutes.
panels.title: Max Connections Configured

panels.description: Bytes Read / Written to disk per second.
panels.title: Read/Write throughput

panels.description: Number of data disk IO read/write operations per second.
panels.title: Read/Write IOPS

options.content: #### **NOTE**: Autovacuum metrics are emitted at a 30-minute interval. To enable these metrics, set the server parameter `metrics.autovacuum_diagnostics` to ON.

panels.description: Estimated number of dead rows for user-only tables in this database
panels.title: Dead Tuples

panels.description: Estimated number of live rows for user-only tables in this database.
panels.title: Live Tuples

panels.description: Estimated bloat percentage for user only tables.
panels.title: Bloat Percent (Preview)

options.content: #### **NOTE**: PgBouncer  metrics are emitted at a 30-minute interval. For PgBouncer metrics to work, both the server parameters `pgbouncer.enabled` and `metrics.pgbouncer_diagnostics` must be enabled.

panels.description: Total number of connection pools
panels.title: Number of connection pools

panels.description: Connections from clients that are associated with an Azure Database for PostgreSQL connection
panels.title: Active client connections

panels.description: Connections to Azure Database for PostgreSQL that are in use by a client connection
panels.title: Active server connections

panels.description: Current number of pooled connections
panels.title: Total pooled connections

panels.description: Connections from clients that are waiting for an Azure Database for PostgreSQL connection to service them
panels.title: Waiting client connections

panels.description: Connections to Azure Database for PostgreSQL that are idle and ready to service a new client connection
panels.title: Idle server connections

options.content: #### **NOTE**: Enhanced metrics are emitted at a 1-minute interval. To enable these metrics, set the server parameter `metrics.collector_database_activity` to ON.

panels.description: Overall state of the backends
panels.title: Sessions by State

panels.description: Sessions by the type of event for which the backend is waiting
panels.title: Sessions By WaitEventType

panels.description: Number of rows that were inserted by queries in this database
panels.title: Tuples Inserted

panels.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed
panels.title: Transactions Committed

panels.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been rolled back
panels.title: Transactions Rolled back

panels.description: Number of times disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache, so that a read wasn't necessary
panels.title: Disk Blocks Hit

panels.description: Number of disk blocks that were read in this database
panels.title: Disk Blocks Read

panels.description: Maximum lag across all asynchronous physical replication slots
panels.title: Physical Replication Lag - On Primary

panels.description: Read replica lag in seconds
panels.title: Read Replica Lag - On Secondry

panels.description: Indicates if the database is up or not in the last 30 days
panels.title: Database availability (Last 30 days)

panels.description: Amount of backup storage used. This metric represents the sum of storage that's consumed by all the full backups, differential backups, and log backups that are retained based on the backup retention period that's set for the server. The frequency of the backups is service managed. For geo-redundant storage, backup storage usage is twice the usage for locally redundant storage
panels.title: Backup Storage Used (last 30 days)

title: Azure / Azure PostgreSQL / Flexible Server Monitoring
